Package com.example.freeturilo.connection

Class APIConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.freeturilo.connection.APIConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    API
    public class APIConnector
extends java.lang.Object
implements API
    A service for Freeturilo API data transaction.

    Object of this class connects to Freeturilo API and handles data transactions of the application. It encapsulates a builder that is used to build connections to various Freeturilo API endpoints.

    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Miko≈Çaj Terzyk
    See Also:
    builder, attachRequestBody(com.example.freeturilo.connection.ExternalConnection, T), retrieveResponseCode(com.example.freeturilo.connection.ExternalConnection), retrieveResponseJsonObject(com.example.freeturilo.connection.ExternalConnection, java.lang.reflect.Type), getStations(), reportStation(com.example.freeturilo.core.Station), setBrokenStation(com.example.freeturilo.core.Station), setWorkingStation(com.example.freeturilo.core.Station), postUser(com.example.freeturilo.misc.AuthCredentials), getRoute(com.example.freeturilo.core.RouteParameters), getState(), postState(com.example.freeturilo.core.SystemState), getNotifyThreshold(), postNotifyThreshold(int), API, APIRunnable, ExternalConnection

    • Method Detail

      • attachRequestBody

        private <T> void attachRequestBody​(@NonNull
                                   ExternalConnection connection,
                                   @NonNull
                                   T object)
                            throws APIException
        Attaches an object to a request within an API connection.

        Prepares an API connection to accept output payload, serializes an object to JSON and writes it to the output stream within the connection.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the sent object
        Parameters:
        connection - an external connection over which the object is sent
        object - an object to serialize to JSON and send over the connection
        Throws:
        APIException - an exception representing an error which occurred when sending the object over the connection

      • retrieveResponseCode

        private int retrieveResponseCode​(@NonNull
                                 ExternalConnection connection)
                          throws APIException
        Retrieves the response code from a response within an API connection.

        Sends a request over an API connection and retrieves its response code. If the code is not HTTP OK (200), disconnects. This method should always be used to submit a request prepared within a connection.

        Parameters:
        connection - an external connection which is the source of the response code
        Returns:
        an integer equal to the response code if it is equal to HTTP OK (200)
        Throws:
        APIException - an exception representing an error which is indicated by the retrieved response code (if not equal to 200)

      • retrieveResponseJsonObject

        @NonNull
private <T> T retrieveResponseJsonObject​(@NonNull
                                         ExternalConnection connection,
                                         @NonNull
                                         java.lang.reflect.Type typeOfObject)
                                  throws APIException
        Retrieves an object from a response within an API connection.

        Reads, deserializes and returns an object from the input stream within an API connection.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the retrieved object
        Parameters:
        connection - an external connection which is the source of the object
        typeOfObject - the type of the retrieved object
        Returns:
        an object retrieved over the connection and deserialized from JSON
        Throws:
        APIException - an exception representing an error which occurred when retrieving the object over the connection

        Asynchronously gets a list of all bike stations. The payload of this transaction should contain the list of all bike stations.
